definition: to maintain order/steward (policing a meeting)
to gather together/to investigate/to entangle/to correct
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

sentences.english: The house perfects often snoop around our campus at night.
sentences.chinese: 學生糾察隊經常夜間在校園裏巡邏。

sentences.english: There were picketers at the front entrance and marchers chanting up and down the street.
sentences.chinese: 大門口站着糾察隊員，請願者在街上游行示威。

sentences.english: They never violate the rules behind the pickets' back.
sentences.chinese: 他們從不背著糾察隊做違紀的事。

sentences.english: To put down the strike, the bosses hae sent out a troop of riotous pickets .
sentences.chinese: 爲了鎮壓罷工，老闆們派出一隊防暴糾察。

sentences.english: Some of the union members did not want to picket.
sentences.chinese: 工會的一些會員不想擔任罷工糾察員。

sentences.english: He picketed outside the school building.
sentences.chinese: 他在學校大樓外擔任糾察員。

sentences.english: Small gatherings picketed outside the school buildings.
sentences.chinese: 三五成羣的人在學校大樓外擔任糾察。
他們在飯館外設置糾察。
罷工工人在工廠周圍設置了糾察隊。

sentences.english: I didn't know he was the proctor this week.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是這星期的糾察隊。

sentences.english: They marched to the factory and formed a picket.
sentences.chinese: 他們向工廠前進，並組成了糾察隊。

sentences.english: The newsreel people were there, taking pictures of the picket .
sentences.chinese: 新聞攝影記者也在那兒，給糾察隊拍照。

sentences.english: We indeed do not like to do the monitoring stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我們真的很不喜歡做這種糾察隊的事情。

sentences.english: The workers picketed the factory gates.
sentences.chinese: 工人在工廠大門口設了糾察線。

sentences.english: The reactionary police cleared out the pickets by force.
sentences.chinese: 反動警察用武力趕走了罷工糾察隊員們。

sentences.english: To put down the strike, the bosses have sent out a troop of riot pickets .
sentences.chinese: 爲了鎮壓罷工，老闆們派出一隊防暴糾察。

fight to the death/desperate struggle
China and Taiwan
low ranking/low level/underclass/subordinate
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
advice/to advise
authority over the household
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
chief offender/main culprit
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to share the booty/to divide ill-gotten gains
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
term of respect/honorific
enemy country
